What is the purpose of the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command in Verus?

The `getidentitieswithrecovery` command is used to retrieve all identities where a specified ID or i-address is the recovery authority. It returns an array of matching identities with additional information such as the transaction hash and output index.

#### Arguments: ```json {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the recovery authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only   "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)   "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height } ``` #### Result: ```json [                 (array) array of matching identities  {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index  ... ] ``` ####Examples: ```bash > verus getidentitieswithrecovery '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrecovery", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/ ``` ### `getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address", "fromheight":height, "toheight":height, "unspent":false}'`#### Arguments: ```json {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the revocation authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only   "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)   "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height } ``` #### Result: ```json [                 (array) array of matching identities  {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index  ... ] ``` ####Examples: ```bash > verus getidentitieswithrevocation '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrevocation", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/ ``` ### `getidentity "name@ || iid" (height) (txproof) (txproofheight)` #### Arguments: ```  "name@ || iid"            (string, required) nam

What are the required and optional arguments for the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command?

The required argument for the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command is `"identityid"`, which is a string representing the ID or i-address of the recovery authority. The optional arguments are `"fromheight"`, `"toheight"`, and `"unspent"`, which are used to filter the search results by block height and UTXO status.

#### Arguments: ```json {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the recovery authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only   "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 == no limit)   "unspent":bool        (bool, optional, default=false) if true, this will only return active ID UTXOs as of the current block height } ``` #### Result: ```json [                 (array) array of matching identities  {identityobject},        (object) identity with additional member "txout" with txhash and output index  ... ] ``` ####Examples: ```bash > verus getidentitieswithrecovery '{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getidentitieswithrecovery", "params": ['{"identityid":"idori-address","fromheight":height,"toheight":height,"unspent":false}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/ ``` ### What is the difference between the `getidentitieswithrecovery` and `getidentitieswithrevocation` commands?

The `getidentitieswithrecovery` command retrieves identities where a specified ID or i-address is the recovery authority, while the `getidentitieswithrevocation` command retrieves identities where a specified ID or i-address is the revocation authority. Both commands have the same arguments and return the same type of result.

#### Arguments: ```json {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the recovery authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, How can I use the `getidentitieswithrecovery` command to search for identities modified within a specific block height range?

You can use the `"fromheight"` and `"toheight"` arguments to specify the block height range for the search. For example, `"fromheight": 100` and `"toheight": 200` would search for identities modified between block heights 100 and 200.

#### Arguments: ```json {   "identityid":"idori-address" (string, required) returns all identities where this ID or i-address is the recovery authority   "fromheight":n        (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities modified from this height forward only   "toheight":n         (number, optional, default=0) Search for qualified identities only up until this height (0 ==
